p: Zip-code level socioeconomic factors included were: percent below poverty, percent unemployed, and percent uninsured. These values were assigned to individuals based on their zip code of residence in 2016. Socioeconomic measures were extracted from the American Community Surveyâ€™s 2016 five-year estimates and were categorized into quartiles.[ 40] The 2016 zip code was used to allow for a more complete match to the American Community Survey.
